DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The time period between the beginning of infancy and the end of adolescence._A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions._Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004_The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The time period between the beginning of infancy and the end of adolescence.:A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions.

Concepts.definition: A time period that begins at the beginning of the human embryonic stage and continues until the end of adolescence.

A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions.
